_comment: Prototype aircraft for Phase 1. ATR 72-600 is the starting aircraft per prototype-scope.md §8.3. A320neo and 737-800 added for Task I.1.

aircraft.name: ATR 72-600
aircraft._specs_comment: Values from prototype-scope.md §8.3 Starting Aircraft Specifications
aircraft._economics_comment: Daily cost ~€3,500 (fuel + crew + mx reserve) - balanced for 60%+ LF profitability. Price reduced to €15M for better pacing (used turboprop value).
aircraft._capacity_comment: 72 seats single class for prototype. No premium classes.
aircraft._notes: Typical route length 300-800 km per prototype-scope.md. Hard to lose money if load factor >50%.

aircraft.name: Airbus A320neo
aircraft._specs_comment: A320neo - most popular narrowbody. New engine option for fuel efficiency.
aircraft._economics_comment: Higher capacity = better unit economics on dense routes. Daily cost includes fuel, 4-person crew, maintenance reserve.
aircraft._capacity_comment: 180 seats single class. Can support business class.
aircraft._notes: Workhorse narrowbody for medium-haul routes (1000-4000km). Best economics at 70%+ load factor on 2-4 hour flights.

aircraft.name: Boeing 737-800
aircraft._specs_comment: 737-800 - proven workhorse, slightly smaller than A320neo.
aircraft._economics_comment: Slightly lower capacity than A320neo but similar operating costs. Better for thinner routes.
aircraft._capacity_comment: 162 seats single class. Can support business class.
aircraft._notes: Classic narrowbody for short-medium haul (800-3500km). Cheaper than A320neo, good for building network density.
